title: 486. “The Art Market Is in Massive Disruption.”
description: Is art really meant to be an “asset class”? Will the digital revolution finally democratize a market that just keeps getting more elitist? And what will happen to the last painting Alice Neel ever made? (Part 3 of “The Hidden Side of the Art Market.”)
author: editor@freakonomics.com (Freakonomics Radio + Stitcher)
